title: Projects

Academic Projects


AI & Change Management – Innovation Adoption Proposal

Role: Lead Consultant








I created a proposal to implement AI in a mid-sized retail company, including a structured change management plan. It addressed resistance, mapped stakeholders, and included long-term training and monitoring strategies.
View full project (PDF)






Eslanda – Sensory Reset Digital Marketing Strategy

Role: Lead Consultant








Led a creative marketing strategy for a wellness startup. My team developed personas, pricing, and a digital campaign plan using tools like Shopify and Hootsuite, focused on emotional clarity and simplicity.
View full project (PDF)






A to Z Urban & Sustainable Consulting – Ethics & CSR Strategy

Role: Group Contributor








Developed a fictitious firm to explore ethical challenges in urban development. The project balanced profitability with social impact, using LEED compliance and CSR frameworks for sustainable city design.
View full project (PDF)






Sears – Strategic Failure in Digital Transformation

Role: Analyst








Analyzed Sears’ decline as a case of failed innovation. The report showed how leadership prioritized financial cuts over customer experience, leading to brand loss. Connected it with change and tech strategy.
View full project (PDF)






Knowledge Management & AI – Business Strategy Case Study

Role: Researcher








Studied how Toyota, IBM, and Lululemon use KM and AI to improve operations. Proposed a roadmap for AI integration, including maturity levels, tacit/explicit knowledge, and governance layers.
View full project (PDF)

title: Business Portfolio
text:
My Journey
I began my career as an architect and urban designer. I loved creating spaces that made sense. But my life transitioned; I moved to Vancouver, Canada, to study for an MBA, finishing in Fall 2025.
For me, it’s been a huge step so far, not just for my career, but because of who I’m becoming. I’m figuring out how to bring that same creative mindset into the world of business. It’s like blending two lives into one. And maybe this sounds like a huge challenge or roadblock, but for me it is my passion; I see it as a world of new possibilities.
In parallel, I co-founded a new startup, a consulting firm based in British Columbia: BusinessBear. The company is focused on providing affordable, personalized services for small businesses and entrepreneurs.
So, I no longer just build and design physical spaces. Now I also sculpt and craft new business ideas, implement strategies, and redefine processes.
That’s the kind of legacy I want to help build.
